page_content: Profile: Ayushi Raichoudhury. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: ayushi@ksom.ac.in. Bio: She is a Ph.D and MBA (Finance) from KIIT School of Management, with more than 8 years of experience in teaching, research and administration. She has published research papers in various national and international journals which are indexed in Web of Science, Scopus and ABDC. She has authored a book chapter in “Methodological Issues in Management Research: Advances, Challenges and the Way Ahead”, published by Emerald. Besides, She has also presented papers in various national and international conferences of repute viz IMRA-IIMB International Conference 2015 at IIM Bangalore, 58thISLE conference 2016 held at IIT Guwahati, 61stAnnual Conference of Indian Society of Labour Economics at Patiala. Prior to joining KIIT, she was appointed by L&T Finance. Being a state level chess champion and a national level chess player; she acknowledges the importance of sports along-with academics. Her teaching interests include Financial management, Indian Financial System and Financial Inclusion.. Info: Research Publication: Raichoudhury, Ayushi. (2020) “Major Determinants of Financial Inclusion: State-Level Evidences from India,” Vision – The Journal Of Business Perspective. Raichoudhury, Ayushi. (2020). “Socio-economic Development Disparity in India: An Inter-state Analysis,” Methodological Issues in Management Research: Advances, Challenges, and the way ahead. (2016), “Financial inclusion & human development: a cross country analysis”, Asian Journal of Business Research, Vol. 6 No. 1, pp. 34-48.

Profile: Ganesh V Radhakrishnan. Role: Senior Professor. Email: gv.radhakrishnan@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Dr. Ganesh V. Radhakrishnan serves as Senior Professor of Finance at KSOM School of Management, bringing a wealth of experience from his tenure as Central Dean of Faculty Affairs at MITWPU and as a faculty member at OP Jindal School of Management. His expertise in maritime economics and strategic leadership was honed through notable naval command positions and further developed as the maritime practice leader at PwC India. In this role, he led significant projects in partnership with global institutions and directed infrastructure development initiatives in countries including Egypt and Sri Lanka. In academia, Dr. Radhakrishnan has served in key positions such as Chief Instructor (Navigation), Training Coordinator, and Commanding Officer of a National Cadet Corps Unit. He has also held academic corporate roles as GM Career Launcher India, Director Shashi Consultancy, and as Associate Dean at OP Jindal Global University. Dr. Radhakrishnan’s research interests lie at the intersection of port economics, environment management and public systems management. He possesses a solid academic foundation with a BSc from the National Defence Academy, an MCA from Madurai Kamaraj University, a PGDM from IIM Kozhikode, and a doctorate from IIM Ahmedabad.. Info:

Profile: Girish Chandra Dey. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: girish.dey@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Dr. Girish Chandra Dey joined the KIIT School of Management as an Assistant Professor in the area of Operations Management in July 2025. He holds a PhD in Supply Chain Management from the Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, India. He has earned his M. Tech. in Industrial Engineering & Management from the Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, India and B.Tech. in Agricultural Engineering & Technology from Odisha University of Agriculture & Technology, Bhubaneswar. Dr. Dey has gained more than 6.5 years of teaching and research experience. Before joining KSOM, he worked as an Assistant Professor at GITAM School of Business, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, and as a lecturer at Rajiv Gandhi University of Knowledge Technologies, R K Valley, Andhra Pradesh. He also worked as a Research Assistant at the Indian Institute of Management Ahmedabad, India. His current research interests include Critical Infrastructure Protection Planning, Supply Chain Design for Disruptions, and Sustainable Supply Chain Management.. Info: Research Publication: Dey, G. C., & Jenamani, M. (2019). Optimizing fortification plan of capacitated facilities with maximum distance limits. OPSEARCH,56(1), 151-173. Baral, M. M., Rao, U. A., Rao, K. S., Dey, G. Profile: Sumita Mishra. Role: Associate Professor. Email: sumita.mishra@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Prof. Mishra is an alumnus of the Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS), Mumbai, where she earned a masters degree in social work. She is a Fellow from the Management Development Institute, Gurgaon. Besides having worked for organizations like CAPART, UNICEF and Tata Refractories Limited, she also has 7 years of teaching experience. She has published several papers in referred journals such as Asian Case Research Journal, Decision, Indian Journal of Industrial Relations, Management Review, International Journal of Indian Culture and Business Management etc. and has also presented papers in national and international conferences of repute. Her interests are in the area of organisational culture, group culture, Strategic Human Resource Management, Social Psychology and Organization Design.. Info: Book Publication: Methodological Issues in Management Research: Advances, Challenges & the way ahead, Emerald Publishing Limited. Profile: Ritika Sharma. Role: Associate  Dean, BBA. Email: ritika.sharma@ksom.ac.in. Bio: She has 4 years of corporate and entrepreneurial experience across FMCG, Telecom and education in domains of sales and distribution, key account management and business development. She has handled entire GSK Consumer Healthcare portfolio for leading modern trade accounts and with Airtel, she was an integral part in establishing Airtel Money foothold in Haryana region. She has an academic experience of more than 7 years. Her areas of interests include consumer behaviour, digital marketing, entrepreneurship and data analysis.. Profile: Ashok Kumar Sar. Role: Senior Professor. Email: aksar@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Prof. Ashok K. Sar is member of faculty in the Strategic Management area. He has a blend of working experience, 20 years in industry and 20 years in academics. For the last 18 years, he has been in full time academic positions (five years of academic experience as Adjunct Faculty Member concurrent to his industry assignment). He served as the Dean of Faculty, KIIT School of Management during 2010 – 2016. He teaches core courses in Strategic Management and Business Ethics & Corporate Social Responsibility and elective course in Pricing Management. He has conducted MDPs for working executives in the areas of Personal Effectiveness, Building Learning Organization, Strategy Execution, Time Management and Quality & Effectiveness through Systems Thinking. He has also developed an eight weeks executive education programme in general management for young working executives. He is in the panel of visiting faculty members at the Odisha Judicial Academy, and trains the state Judicial Officers on Management Skills. Prior to his present assignment, he worked with Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) for twenty years in varied areas of responsibilities, such as,  Marketing Operations, Sales and Supply Network Planning & Development, Business Development in Retail, Industrial & Consumer Segments, LPG and Lubricants; Training & Development; Business Partner – Human Resource Management; Management Control and Reporting Systems; and Enterprise Resource Planning. He published two patents, and thirty-four papers in peer reviewed journals. Eighteen of these papers are in SCOPUS/ Web of Science/ ABDC index/ list. He has guided six Ph.D. scholars and is guiding six more scholars, who are in various stages of their research work. He has completed an ICSSR-IMPRESS funded major research project titled- “Impact of Dynamic Capability on Success of Entrepreneurs: A Study of Small and Medium Manufacturers in Odisha”.. Profile: B.C.M.Patnaik. Role: Professor. Email: bcmpatnaik@ksom.ac.in. Bio: More than24 yearsof rich experience in Educational Research, Content and Creative initiativeat both post graduate and undergraduate level, ability to handle core administration related activities such as infrastructure, facility, human resources, training and development of staff members and organizational behavior and organization development. Possessing valuable insights, keen analysis and team approach to implement best practices, adept at working in high pressure environments with strict deadlines and multiple deliverables. Introduce knowledge and assist the students to develop the skills necessary for success. As a faculty of Accounts & Finance, introduced students to the principles, process, tools and techniques becoming the foundation of their ability to understand and take up challenges throughout their education and into their professional careers. Expertise in planning, organizing, coordinating and monitoring all types of curricular and co-curricular activities for the overall development of personality of students. Devoted teacher striving to help students change marginal grades into good grades and supporting colleagues and administration in facilitating each child’s social and intellectual growth by creating an atmosphere of mutual respect and open communication.  Guided 26 Ph.D Scholars and guiding 6 scholars. Published more than 300 papers including 130 papers inScopusindexed journals. Awarded Best Faculty 4 times.. Profile: Sudeshna Rath. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: Sudeshna.rath@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Dr. Sudeshna Rathis a dedicated academician and researcher in the field ofOperations Management. She earned herPh.D. from IIT Roorkee. With 2.5 years of teaching experience and an equal duration of industrial exposure, she brings a well-rounded perspective to her academic role. Sudeshna’s notable academic achievements include 4 years of research experience, where she has successfully published research papers in peer-reviewed journals indexed in Scopus. Additionally, she has actively contributed to the academic community by presenting her work at international conferences and serving as a reviewer for Scopus-indexed peer-reviewed journals. Her specialization encompasses a diverse array of areas, including Manufacturing Strategy, Production Operations Management, Multivariate Analysis, Service Operations Management, Supply Chain Management, and Quality Management, reflecting her wide-ranging expertise in management and operations.. Profile: Shanta Sagar Mohapatra. Role: Adjunct Asst. Professor. Email: shanta.mohapatra@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Degree in accounting (Hon.) with Chartered Accountant from The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India. A highly skilled and experienced Chartered Accountant with 15+ years of work experience in financial management which includes accounting, budgeting, costing, variance analysis, reporting and auditing. For the past 15 years, he has worked for multiple companies in India including Big4s like PwC and KPMG as a Chartered Accountant and have much success and experience to offer from this position. He is fully capable in all aspects of the role and can handle internal and external auditing, systems design, basic accounting, and statuary audits. He is absolutely accurate, quick, and offer quality work in every part of his job. He holds a degree from north Orissa University in Accounting, and have taken several courses to accelerate his career expertise. He has great financial, math, and analytical skills and also, work well with people.. Info:

Profile: Isa Mishra. Role: Associate Professor. Email: isa.mishra@ksom.ac.in. Bio: She has 26 years of working experience including six years as Faculty-HR at IBAT and KSOM and over 18 years of experience in all gamuts of HR in varied sectors –Power, Telecom – both services & infrastructure & Port, both at corporate and site. This includes experience in Strategic and Operational HR & Administration in reputed companies like Orissa Hydro Power Corporation Ltd., a state Govt. PSU; AIRCEL; Adani Dhamra Port Company Ltd. and Tata Refractories Ltd. During these work stints, she has played a lead role while designing, revamping & implementing customized HR processes, assisting management in wage rationalization, merger & acquisition and being a change agent during transitions. Corporate experience includes 12 years in lead HR & Admin role. She has been conducting MDPs in the areas of communication and etiquette, emotional intelligence, labor laws and compliances, time management, stress management, diversity and inclusion, POSH, etc. for corporate houses and has worked in HR consulting in the following areas: Competency Mapping, Job Analysis and Evaluation, Performance Management, HR policies and processes. Her professional associations include being part of NHRDN, BBSR Chapter as Secretary from May, 2009 till March, 2014 & as Treasurer since April, 2014 till date. She has been Sub-Editor, NIPM, Utkal Chapter from Apr’00 till March’05. Since Dec’97, she has been conducting several personality development workshops & rendered classes at institutes including KSOM, IMIS, OEC, ASM, Silicon Engineering College, MSM for students prior to placement. Her academic credentials include MA in PMIR (gold medalist of 93-95) batch; M. Phil. in PMIR; LLB & Ph.D. She is a certified Thomas International’s PPA Practitioner since June, 2016. Profile: Suchi Smita Swain. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: suchi.swain@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Prof. Suchi Smita Swainholds a B.A. (Hons) in Economics from BJB Autonomous College, Utkal University, and earned her M.A. in Analytical and Applied Economics from Utkal University. She was a full-time Ph.D scholar at the National Institute of Technology Silchar, Assam, and has extensive experience as a Teaching Assistant at NIT Silchar, teaching managerial economics to undergraduate students. Her research interests include migration and remittances, labor economics, development studies, and rural economics. She possesses strong technical skills in econometric analysis and is proficient in software tools such as STATA, R, and SPSS. She has published papers in reputable SCOPUS and Web of Science-indexed journals and presented at international conferences. Committed to interdisciplinary research and effective teaching, she aims to contribute to rural economic development and inclusive growth through her academic pursuits.. Profile: Abhishek Kumar. Role: Associate Professor. Email: abhishekkr5@ksom.ac.in. Bio: With over 7 years of industry experience he has served companies like Standard Charted Bank, ICICI Prudential and Tata AIG Life and has been in roles ranging from Manager to Branch Head. Prof. Kumar has got the highest award and acclamation during his tenure in said organisations. For example, Winner of “Superstar of the Company” in ICICI Prudential, recipient of “Hercules Award” in Tata AIG Life for the financial year 2008-2009. He was sent to Dubai for the best performance where he achieved No. 1 position PAN INDIA. Promoted as Branch Head in 2009 Prof. Kumar became the best Branch Head and received the most prestigious award “Hour of Power” thrice during his stint which depicts his dedication towards work. His area of research includes Marketing Management and Monetary Policy. More than a dozen research papers in regional and national seminars are to his credit. Prof. Kumar was awarded with ‘ Dr. Asha Sablok Memorial Gold Medal’ for the best conference research paper. He has authored books like “Central Loans to States and Finance Commission”,”Impact of Global Financial Crisis on Indian Economy”, “Micro Finance and Rural Development” and “Market Reforms and Inclusive Growth”. His edited book “Central Loans to States and Finance Commission” has been released by Dr. Montek Singh Ahuwalia, Deputy Chairman, Planning Commission of India in the 93rd Annual Conference of the Indian Economic Association.. Info: Book Publication: Economic Growth in India, Shandilya Publications. Profile: Satyajit Kamila. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: satyajit.kamila@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Satyajit joined as Assistant Professor in the area of Operations Management at KIIT School Of Management in July 2023. Industrial Experience Satyajit gained a significant amount of industry experience over a period of 11 years, holding several managerial capabilities in diverse sectors such as Production, Supply Chain, Contract & Procurement, Inventory Management, Project Management etc. This experiential learning was gained at Rashtriya Chemicals & Fertilisers (RCF), a NAVRATNA PSU under Ministry of Chemicals & Fertilisers, GOI. Research Interests His current areas of research interest include Supply Chain Modelling incorporating sustainability; Perishable Inventory Systems; Revenue Sharing Models in coordinated supply chains and Case Research method in Operations Management.. Profile: Poornima Mahapatra. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: poornima.mahapatra@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Poornima Mahapatra completed her Ph.D in Management from Xavier Institute of Management, Xavier University, Bhubaneswar in the year 2018. Her research interests include Sensemaking, Organizational Change and Qualitative Research. She has been teaching post-graduate and undergraduate students for the last 8 years. Her teaching interests include Organizational Behaviour, Organizational Theory and Design and Organizational Change. She has also worked as a freelance consultant and her consulting work includes developing cases and evaluation at virtual assessment centres.. Info:

Profile: Sambit Kumar Dash. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: sambitk.dash@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Prof. Sambit Kumar Dash is an academic and researcher in management with a focused interest in energy systems, operations, and strategy. He holds an MBA from XIM Bhubaneswar and is UGC-NET qualified in Management. With over 5 years of experience in teaching and consulting, he has contributed to projects involving project management, monitoring & evaluation, and stakeholder engagement. Currently pursuing his PhD at the Indian Institute of Management Sambalpur (since 2022), his research interests span sustainable energy transitions, digital transformation in the energy sector, business strategy, and applied economics. Passionate about quantitative analysis, Prof. Dash enjoys working with data and numbers to derive actionable insights in business horizons. He has actively participated in several national and international conferences, including forums such as POMS and PAN IIM Conference, further strengthening his academic exposure.. Info:

Profile: Saroj K. Routray. Role: Associate Professor. Email: saroj@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Prof. Saroj is a qualified Cost Accountant and is an alumnus of IIM Ahmedabad. He holds post-graduation degrees both in Management and in Commerce and has done Ph.D. from Utkal University. He has worked in Finance and Management Accounting functions in the industry for 3 years and has an academic experience of 20 years. He teaches Corporate Accounting, Cost & Management Accounting, Security Analysis & Portfolio Management at BBA and MBA programmes. He has conducted MDPs for UNICEF, Hindalco, OPTCL, Vedanta Aluminium, Visa Steel, PPL, OHPC, IMFA, CESU, Stone India Limited and Crompton & Greaves. He has also worked as a consultant to CAPART, Ministry of Rural Development, Govt. of India, for monitoring and evaluating the projects sponsored by the organisation in Odisha, West Bengal, and Chhattisgarh, His doctoral research is in corporate governance and has a couple of research papers identifying the relationship between Firm Performance and Corporate Governance. Currently, he has completed an ICSSR funded project on Ageing Population and Government Interventions. Apart from research papers, he has also written a couple of cases in accounting and finance domain.. Profile: Anubhav Mishra. Role: Professor. Email: anubhav.mishra@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Dr. Anubhav Mishra is a Professor of Marketing at the KIIT School of Management. Previously, he has taught at the Goa Institute of Management (GIM; AMBA Accredited), T. A. Pai Management Institute (TAPMI; AACSB and AMBA Accredited), ICFAI Business School (IBS; AACSB Accredited), and Amrita School of Business (ASB; AACSB Accredited). He was also associated with Reliance Telecom Ltd. He has qualified for the UGC NET (2012) and completed the Management Teacher’s Program. His research focuses on the role of consumer psychology with strategic marketing implications in the field of branding, retailing, spatial and numerical processing, and consumption experiences. His work has been published/forthcoming in the Journal of Consumer Behavior, Journal of Brand Management, International Journal of Market Research, Journal of Strategic Marketing, Journal of Consumer Marketing, International Review of Retail, Distribution and Consumer Research, Journal of Global Marketing, and International Journal of Politics, Culture, and Society amongst others. Till date, his research has been cited in class leading journals like the Journal of Marketing (ABDC Journal Ranking ‘A*’; FT50), Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science (ABDC Journal Ranking ‘A*’; FT50), and Journal of Business Ethics (FT50). He teaches Marketing Research, Product and Brand Management, Retailing Management, Customer Relationship Management, Marketing Management, and Advanced Marketing Management. He has written a book and presented papers at many international and national conferences. He has conducted several MDP/FDPs. Google Scholar citations – 506 (Click Here). Profile: Ipsita Nayak. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: ipsita.nayak@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Dr. Ipsita Nayak has completed her PhD from Utkal University and a Certificate course in Communication and Management Essentials from IIT, Kharagpur. Her doctoral research on the theme of “Social Exclusion” is in the area of Indian English fiction. She has 20 years of teaching experience in the area of Communicative English, Business Communication and Managerial Communication. She conducts training programmes for employees at various capacities in different organizations. She has designed and facilitated training at NINL, NTPC, Tata Power, SIDBI and ESSPL. Dr. Nayak has delivered several talks in academic forums as a resource person and invited speaker. She has an expertise in designing ABL (activity-based learning) sessions. She offers personalized solutions to the problems concerning the communication competency of students/ trainees. She believes in upgrading herself with perpetual research. Her research orientation is reflected in her numerous presentations in seminars and conferences and in her publications in both print and electronic media. She is also associated with reputed journals as a reviewer. Her research interests include World literature, Tribal literature, Postcolonial literature, Sustainability studies and Cultural Studies.. Info: Research Publication: Satapathy, M.; Nayak, I., “The Lioness Defending her clan in the North East: A Study of Ecospiritual Elements in Mamang Dia’s Fiction,” Rupkatha Journal of Interdisciplinary Studies in Humanities.

Profile: Suvasis Ghosh. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: suvasis.ghosh@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Prof.  Suvasis Ghosh is an alumnus of the Indian Institute of Foreign Trade (IIFT), New Delhi, where he earned a master’s degree in International Business. He has over 20 years of experience in Strategy and Marketing, having worked with leading MNCs like Deloitte, KPMG, Archer Daniels Midland, YES Bank, and Cargill. He has served as a Strategic Management Consultant with expertise spanning Food and Agribusiness, as well as the Consumer Sector. He has provided advisory services to both Private and Public Clients, covering a range of projects/initiatives including business plan formulation, partner search, organizational restructuring, policy planning and advocacy, financial advisory, among others. He’s been a member of advisory councils in industry bodies like FICCI and CII, and has published multiple thought leadership pieces on the consumer sector during his corporate tenure. Presently, he holds the position of Marketing Professor at KIIT School of Management, Bhubaneswar.. Info:

Profile: Manoj Kumar Jena. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: manoj.jena@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Prof. Manoj has corporate experience of over 10 years spanning diverse sectors such as manufacturing, IT, Automotive, and finance. He has worked in different projects for companies like OCFL, WIPRO, Geometrics Ltd, Dana Automobile, and Institutional Investors Advisory Services (IiAS): capital markets, Mumbai. His area of interest includes Data Analytics & Machine Learning, Predictive Modelling, Dynamic Pricing, Operations management, Logistics and supply chain management and Analytics, Corporate finance and Economics.. Profile: Prasun Bhatta Mishra. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: prasun.mishra@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Prof. Prasun Bhatta Mishra has obtained his Bachelors in Mechanical Engineering from BITS Pilani-Goa and his Masters in Economics from the Gokhale Institute of Politics and Economics, Pune. He has qualified the UGC NET (Economics). Until recently he was a full-time PhD scholar at the Indira Gandhi Institute of Development Research (IGIDR), an advanced research institution set up by the Reserve Bank of India and has submitted his dissertation for evaluation. His work experience in Industry comprises stints as a Design Engineer at Hindustan Aeronautics Limited and as a Health Economist at BresMed Health Solutions. His work experience in Academia comprises stints as an Assistant Professor at Symbiosis School of Economics, Pune and at the KIIT School of Management before proceeding for his doctoral studies. He has also taught as a guest faculty in the Business Analytics Program at SCMHRD, Pune. Prof. Prasun specializes in teaching quantitative courses such as Econometrics, Operations Research and Statistics. His research interests include Applied Econometrics, Health Economics, Household Economics and a bit of Industrial Organization. He has also conducted a faculty development program in Modeling with Excel for the faculty-members of Symbiosis International University and a workshop in Data Analysis with Excel for IDBI officers, Bhubaneswar. Journal Publications: Conference Presentations:. Info:

Profile: Siddharth Ranjan. Role: Assistant Adjunct Professor. Email: arth.ranjan@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Siddharth Ranjan is a Chartered Accountant with over25 years of post-qualification experience, combining corporate leadership, consulting, and teaching. A fellow member of theInstitute of Chartered Accountants of Indiasince 2000, he has held senior finance roles in reputed healthcare and corporate organisations, including VBCT – Vigyan Bharati Charitable Trust, Kalinga Hospital Ltd, Tatwa Technologies Ltd, and Milk Mantra Pvt Ltd. He also has experience working with IndusInd Bank, Ernst & Young (Sri Lanka), and PwC (Maldives) early in his career. He has also represented clients as a former partner of Tej Raj & Pal – Chartered Accountants- at the ITAT- Income Tax Appellate Tribunal. He continues to practice Tax Laws. Siddharth is also a community leader, writer, and active participant in ICAI Bhubaneswar, where he has served in multiple elected roles. He holds the following qualifications: B.Com (Hons), LLB, FCA, JAIIB. He is known for mentoring young professionals and propagating constitutional and democratic values through civic engagements.. Info:

Profile: Sweta Singh. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: sweta.singh@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Sweta Singhis an Assistant Professor of Human Resource Management at KIIT School of Management (KSoM). She is a Fellow Programme in Management (FPM) scholar in Organizational Behavior at XLRI – Xavier School of Management, India. Her academic trajectory includes roles at the Indian School of Business (ISB), Hyderabad, as an Academic Associate, and at ISB Mohali as a Research Analyst with the Bharti Institute of Public Policy. Sweta has prior industry experience with WNS Global Services and has also interned at SAIL and IDBI Federal Life Insurance. She has presented her research at several leading academic conferences including the British Academy of Management (BAM), Australia and New Zealand Academy of Management (ANZAM), and the ISDSI-Global Conference. An alumna of the Madras School of Economics and Symbiosis International University, her research lies at the intersection of sustainability, climate change attitudes in organizations, workplace behavior, negotiations, and gender dynamics. She has also taken guest sessions at XLRI and IIM Raipur as part of Management Development Programs (MDPs), focusing on negotiation strategies and inclusive work-life practices. Beyond academia, Sweta is an emerging author with two published creative works, including her contribution to the widely acclaimed anthologyUnsent Letters from the South Asian Diaspora, reflecting her interest in culture, emotion, and identity narratives.. Info: Book Publication: Unsent Letters from the South Asian Diaspora An Egghead’s Journal

Profile: Biswajit Das. Role: Professor. Email: biswajit@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Dr. Das joined KIIT University since 1999 and has 30 years of experience in academia, administration and government. He has authored 12 books (national and International), 194 research papers (National and International), awarded with 21 Ph.D. research scholars (Indian and International) & 8 scholars are under guidance and implemented funded projects. His outstanding books include ‘Real Estate Market’ (Excel Books), ‘Transnational Marketing Strategy’ (New Age Publication) and ‘Business Communication and Personality Development’ (Excel Books). Prof. Das was Member-Board of Management, Member -Academic Council, Deputy Registrar (Academics), Chairperson- Doctoral Programme, Chairperson- Marketing Management Area and has been instrumental in the institution building process of KSOM since its inception. He has Board of studies member of several state and central universities and external expert for Ph.D. scholars, invited as speaker and conducts MDP. Prof. Das is a visiting external expert (opponent) to Tallinn University of Technology (TUT), Estonia-Europe for doctoral research and has presented sever research papers in national and international conferences (adjudged with best paper) in South East Asia, Europe, Middle East, particularly in NTU-Singapore, SQU-Oman, AIT-Bangkok and TUT-Estonia in the domain of value creation, servitisation, Economic inclusion, digital markets, disaster resilience, communication & advertising , real estate and eco-tourism.. Info: Book Publication: Business Communication & Personality Development, Excel Books. The book reflects on the core contents of communication needed in a business environment. It has unique chapters which are essential for broadening the horizon of thought and inculcating capabilities to read, write and speak better. Organisational Communication, LAP LAMBERT Academic Publishing. This book on organisational communication teaches on the aspects of organisational communication across hierarchies. It spells on the activities involved with any organisation. Trans-national Marketing Strategy, New Age International Publications, New Delhi. This book is for understanding international market forces and their strategies. It contains the essence of strategic methods through which business can be driven in a global market. Biological Warfare, LAP Lambert Academic Publishing. Biological warfare is a book written in the times of corona; exploring the reasons of the pandemic. It details on the antiquities of the pandemic more vividly from the days of swine flu of 1918. Eventually delved deep into the periodic emergence of pandemics and their impact on human beings. Profile: Ipseeta Satpathy. Role: Senior Professor. Email: ipseeta@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Prof. Ipseeta Satpathy has over 25 years of experience in teaching, research and administration at KIIT University. She has authored six textbooks such as “Environment Management”, “Business Communication & Personality Development” published by Excel Books, New Delhi, Transnational Marketing Strategy, published by New Age International Publishers, Organizational Communication published by Lap Lambert, Mauritius and Empowering Award Staff by Revamping Training System in Banks, published by Lap Lambert, Germany. Dr. Satpathy has published more than 300 research papers in various referred national & international journals including journals in ABDC category, conference proceedings and has more than 150 research papers in Scopus indexed journals. Prof. Satpathy is a former visiting professor, Lynchburg College, Virginia, USA and has attended/presented research papers in several international conferences including the International Conference on HRM &PD in the Digital Age in Singapore, Cambridge Business & Economics Conference, Cambridge University, UK, and some of her research papers have also won the Best Paper Award including one which was adjudged as the best paper by Emerald group publishing ltd. Prof Satpathy is guiding several research scholars for the Ph.D degree and 29 of her scholars have been awarded Ph.D degree by KIIT Deemed to be University and she has also conducted a number of Management Development Programmes . Dr. Satpathy has been awarded the prestigious Oxford Journal Distinguished Research Professor Award 2014 at Cambridge University, London. Dr. Satpathy was invited by the Charlton Business School University of Massachusetts, Dartmouth, USA to address the faculties & the students. Prof Satpathy was invited by the Southampton University, UK, where she also addressed the faculties, students and research scholars. Dr. Ipseeta Satpathy, was felicitated with the Times Power Women 2023, by the Times of India (TOI) group as an eminent academician in producing and upskilling quality professionals for today’s workforce.. Profile: Arun Kumar Biswal. Role: Associate Professor. Email: arun.biswal@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Arun Kumar Biswal is Associate Professor of Operations Management at the KIIT School of Management. He holds a PhD in Supply Chain Management from the prestigious Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kharagpur. He completed his Bachelor in Electrical Engineering from the National Institute of Technology, Rourkela and earned a Post Graduate Diploma in Industrial Engineering (PGDIE) from the National Institute of Industrial Engineering (NITIE), Mumbai, a leading institution in industrial engineering and operations management. Before transitioning to academia, Dr. Biswal gained nearly a decade of professional experience in project management and supply chain management, working across both private and government sectors. His roles included optimizing processes, managing large-scale projects, and ensuring operational efficiency. He holds several professional certifications, including Project Management Professional (PMP), Certified Supply Chain Professional (CSCP), and Lean Six Sigma Black Belt, enhancing his industry expertise. Dr. Biswal’s research focuses on integrating technology into supply chain management, with particular interests in the humanitarian supply chain, RFID applications, inventory inaccuracy, and food security. He has published research papers in leading international journals such as Transportation Research Part E, Computers and Industrial Engineering, and Socio-Economic Planning Sciences, offering insights that bridge academic theory and practical application. His research contributes to improving supply chain resilience and efficiency in both commercial and humanitarian contexts. Dr. Biswal is also passionate about industry-academia collaborations, and he integrates real-world insights into his teaching through case studies and practical examples.. Profile: Prof. Sarbeswar Mohanty. Role: Professor of practice. Email: sarbeswar.mohanty@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Prof.Sarbeswar Mohanty is an alumnus of S.P Jain Institute of Management & Research, Mumbai and was awarded his Master’s Degree in Management Studies from University of Mumbai. He is an accomplished business leader with over 35 years of rich experience in senior leadership roles, having successfully handled P & L responsibilities across diverse industry verticals, including Retail, B2B and Manufacturing. His expertise spans across key sectors such as FMCG, Petroleum & Petro Chemicals, Aviation, Cement and Infrastructure, where he has consistently driven business growth, operational excellence and strategic transformations. Prof.Mohanty has been associated with some of India’s most renowned corporations and has held top management positions at Godrej-GE, Reliance Industries and Shree Cement and his leadership has played a crucial role in shaping business strategies, optimising operations and delivering sustained profitability at these organisations. He also has been keynote speaker at various International conferences & workshops representing RIL at Argus & PACE etc. With a deep passion for mentoring & knowledge sharing, Prof.Mohanty is now leveraging his vast corporate experience to contribute to business consulting & academia at KIIT School Of Management.. Profile: Koustubh Kanti Ray. Role: Professor. Email: kkray@ksom.ac.in. Bio: He is currently a Professor of Finance at School of Management, KIIT Deemed to be University.  In a career spanning more than a decade, he has served in leading national level institutions in the country – Indian Institute of Forest Management, Bhopal; Indian Institute of Management, Raipur, and Institute for Financial Management and Research, Chennai. Dr. Ray has a passion for teaching and taught business valuation, financial engineering, merger & acquisition and corporate finance at one or more of the above institutions. He regularly conducts management training programs for corporate and government executives in finance and related subjects. His research interests are mainly in the areas of corporate finance and financial markets.. Profile: Shikta Singh. Role: Associate Professor. Email: shiktasingh@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Dr. Shikta Singh has a great passion for Teaching & Research. Presently she is serving as an Associate Professor in KIIT School of Management, KIIT University, an institution of eminence. She was also the Head of Finance & Economics Area (2022-24) & MBA Chairperson of Healthcare Management at the Institute. She is a successful corporate trainer, training industry people on finance & technical skills. She has been an alumnus of Utkal University, Ravenshaw University, and Pune University. She has completed her PhD in the area of Applied & Analytical Economics and has completed the advanced Program in Applied Finance from IIM Calcutta. She brings with her more than 14 years of rich teaching experience in Universities like-KIIT University, Utkal University, Abhinav Institute of Management & Research, Pune. She is also a Visiting Professor to a few reputed institutions of Odisha & Outside. Her current research interest lies in various Macro Economic issues, Behavioural Finance, International Financial Management, Industrial Economics and Development Economics. She has authored around 30 research papers of national and international repute in the area of macroeconomics, industrial economics, behavioural finance, Stock market dynamics, and management as published 7 Book chapters and Two Books. She has been guiding research scholars, of which six scholars have been awarded. She is also the Editor of Parikalpana- Imagineering Business- A UGC Care Journal. She is the recipient of multiple awards and is a gold medallist.  She has worked on two research projects for RBI Bulletin and on Health care for a Consultancy. She has been Resource Persons and Keynote Speaker to some of the reputed institutions in the country and state as well. She is a regular panellist for Budget discussions and other economic discussions on Kalinga TV, News 18, DD Odia, Ten News channel. Going by the current scenario she is well versed with blended- learning techniques and taking up sessions on online platforms. She is well versed in designing e-contents for e-learning platforms. Her MOOCs in Behavioural Finance is active in theSwayam Portalwith enrolled participants of more than 5500. She has conducted multiple webinars, ATAL FDPs, MDPs and online research workshops, international conferences crowding masses of more than 3000 participants from various universities and corporates from India and abroad and also have trained faculties on using techniques for online teaching. She also has written blogs on economic significance, news columns. She has successfully bagged various projects approved by ATAL, AICTE, ICSSR & MHRD, Swayam GOI. Presented papers in various International Conferences viz. in Singapore 2014, ERAZ Conference held at Belgrade 2017, and ICOM 2017 Conference at Abu Dhabi, ICOM 2019 MICA, and IMC 2020 held at Delhi, Singapore & Nottingham University UK in 2024. She has been a position holder in her 12th, Post graduate and M.Phil level and has received gold medal for the same. Apart from that she has got 0.1 merit certificate and Gold medal for being the All India Topper in Economics during 12th board. She believes in a society where everyone has a standard of living that enables one to realise one’s potential. Dr. Shikta stands for smartly using resources towards addressing economic & social issues. Very recently she was awarded with the APJ Abdul Kalam teachers excellence award from AICTE GOI for her contribution in the field of education by honorable education minister of State Shri Subhas Sarkar at the Constitution club of India, New Delhi IN 2021 and also was awarded with the Bharat Samman Niddhi Purushkar held in Delhi Vidhan Sabha in 2024.. Profile: Arvind Tripathy. Role: Dean - MBA. Email: dean@ksom.ac.in, arvind@ksom.ac.in. Bio: MBA, Ph.D. (Management), FDP (IIM Ahmedabad) Prof. Arvind Tripathy is associated with School of Management since 2008. He has 25years of experience consisting of 7 years of corporate experience and 18 years in academics. A Ph.D. in Management in the marketing area, he is an alumnus of the Department of Business Administration, Utkal University. He is an alumnus of IIM Ahmedabad (FDP program 2013). His Ph.D. topic was “A multilevel exploration of factors influencing retail image and patronage and service quality assessment of retail centres”. He was associated with the advertising industry in Mumbai and Bangalore and media services in IT training Kolkata. Later he moved to the academic world of management education. He has been a resource person/trainer in various marketing workshops of national and international fame. ‘Enhancing the capacity of middle and small scale enterprises in Orissa Regional Chapter’ was a European Union- Govt. of India project. Served as a marketing consultant for ‘Capacity enhancing’ program for the craftsman and handicrafts trading societies from Orissa organized by Trade Kraft UK and IRFT Mumbai. He is also involved in projects from Indian Council of Social Science Research, New Delhi (Ministry of MHRD, Govt. of India) in social sector as  Co-Project Investigator.. Profile: Jyotiranjan Hota. Role: Associate Professor. Email: jrhota@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Dr. Hota has around 18 years of experience in teaching and research. His teaching interests include Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Mining, Visual Analytics, SAP functional Modules, R and Python. His PhD thesis is based on Adoption of Multivendor ATM technology in India. His thesis identifies the issues pertaining to the adoption of this technology from customer, supplier and banker’s perspective. In his study, he has developed and validated several qualitative and quantitative models on drivers and barriers of Multivendor ATM technology adoption. His research interest lies in linking Information Technology with all the functional areas of management. Dr. Hota is an AIMA accredited Management teacher in IT Area. His research work has been published inInternational Journal of BankMarketing(Emerald Publishing, UK),Asia Pacific Journal of InformationSystems (KMIS, South Korea), The IUP Journal ofApplied Economics, AIMS International Journal of Management, IUPJournal of Information Technology,Vision: The Journal of Business Perspective (Sage Publication),Palgrave Macmillan,Computer Society of India, Springer Natureand many leading, refereed national and international journals. He has served as program committee member, advisory board member, scientific committee member, technical committee member, academic committee member, track chair and session chair of international conferences in India and abroad. Dr. Hota is the recipient ofICBM-AMP Academic Excellence Awards 2018in the category of ‘Best Professor in IT and Operations’ held at Hyderabad, India.. Data Mining and Business Intelligence: Data-driven strategy for business transformation (English Edition). BPB Publications. About the Textbook:About the Textbook:  Data mining powers modern business intelligence by transforming complex datasets into actionable insights that drive smarter decisions, operational efficiency and strategic growth. This book begins with the critical step of data preprocessing, guiding readers through techniques such as data cleaning, integration, transformation and reduction to ensure high-quality inputs for analysis. It then introduces core data mining methods like regression, classification, clustering and association rules followed by foundational business intelligence concepts including data warehousing, ETL processes and dashboard creation and data modelling using Power BI. The textbook also delves into advanced topics such as text mining and big data analytics while offering a critical discussion on ethical data practices. The final chapter emphasizes the importance of data governance, ethical frameworks and responsible data management, preparing readers to lead with integrity in a world increasingly shaped by artificial intelligence and data-driven decision making.

Profile: Arnav Pati. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: arnav.pati@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Prof. Arnav Pati is an Assistant Professor of Marketing at KIIT School of Management (KSoM). He is a Fellow Program in Management (PhD) specialising in the Marketing area from the Xavier School of Management, XLRI – Jamshedpur, where he researched brand logo design strategies. His academic credentials also include a Master’s degree in Analytical and Applied Economics from Utkal University and a Bachelor’s degree in Economics from BJB Autonomous College, Odisha. Prof. Pati has a strong background in brand strategy and marketing innovation. As the founder of Marcuscope, a branding agency, he has played a pivotal role in shaping over 220 brands across diverse industries, including software and aviation. His expertise spans brand identity design, digital marketing, and content management, making him a sought-after consultant in the field. At KSoM, Prof. Pati teaches Marketing Management and Business Research Methods. His research interests focus on brand design, responsible marketing, and consumer psychology, with an emphasis on how visual identity systems influence consumer decision-making. He is committed to advancing marketing scholarship while bridging the gap between research and practice. In addition to his academic and professional endeavours, he is passionate about music production, photography, and animal welfare.. Info:

Profile: P.R. Sahoo. Role: Associate Professor. Email: prsahoo@ksom.ac.in. Bio: Area Chair – Marketing Dr. Priti Ranjan Sahoo is an Associate Professor at the KIIT School of Management, KIIT University. Prof. Sahoo has more than 30 years of experience in both industry and academics. He served in various Managerial positions with Indian Tourism Development Corporation (ITDC) from 1994 to 2003. He taught at Birla Institute of Technology, Mesra, Ranchi, from 2003 to 2009 as a Reader before joining KIIT University in 2009. He received the Ph.D. for his doctoral research on the theme “An Analytical Study on the Perception for the Application of Electronic Distribution Systems.” He holds double master’s degrees in MBA & MTA and is an FDPM alumnus of IIM Ahmedabad. He has Eight Patents to his credit (Five Indian, Two Australian, and one German). He is a Visiting Professor at Sinop University, Turkey. He has served on the editorial board of many reputed national and international journals. Currently, he is the Editor-in-Chief of “Indian Journal of Hospitality Management” having ISSN: 2582 4082, the official journal of IHM, Ahmedabad. Three of his research scholars have completed their Ph.D. under his guidance, and currently, six scholars are working on their Ph.D. degrees under his guidance. He has been a thesis examiner and external examiner of Ph.D. candidates at several Universities. He has published several research papers indexed in Scopus, ABDC, and UGC-approved journals. He acts as a reviewer of Research Journals of International repute. He is an active member of many professional and academic bodies. He has provided consultancy services to many leading Service Industries in the country. He has successfully completed three research consultancy projects independently. Presently he is working on two live research projects sponsored by IIM Ahmedabad and the Indian Council of Social Science Research. Prof. Sahoo has been invited to deliver Keynote Address and Session Chair for several Conferences. He has conducted five training programmes for Govt./Corporate Sector agencies. He has been a resource person for several Faculty Development Programmes/ MDP/ Workshops/Conferences/ Seminars. His teaching and research interests include Strategic Management, Information Technology, Business Policy, International Business, Services Marketing, Tourism & Hospitality, Entrepreneurship, and E-Commerce.
